DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for colon and rectal carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic M stage, one criteria of the TMN staging system where  M refers to the presence of metastasis, of a colorectal tumor

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-28-19 ownership transfer approved by CTEP/B.Campbell; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pM1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pM1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to the peritoneal surface alone or with other site or organ metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pM1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to the peritoneal surface alone or with other site or organ metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to two or more sites or organs without peritoneal metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to two or more sites or organs without peritoneal metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one site or organ without peritoneal metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one site or organ without peritoneal metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one or more distant sites or organs or peritoneal metastasis is identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one or more distant sites or organs or peritoneal metastasis is identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one or more distant sites or organs or peritoneal metastasis is identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to one or more distant sites or organs or peritoneal metastasis is identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer without evidence of distant metastasis by imaging, etc.; no evidence of tumor in distant sites or organs. This category is not assigned by pathologists. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer without evidence of distant metastasis by imaging, etc.; no evidence of tumor in distant sites or organs. This category is not assigned by pathologists. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
